sentences.en: But this kind of exhibition is easyly to be made into hodgepodge.
sentences.cn: 但是这种展览也容易做成大杂烩.

sentences.en: Fang Hung - chien wished he could have said, No wonder your honorable work is such a hodgepodge.
sentences.cn: 方鸿 渐 恨不能说: “怪不得阁下的大作也是那样斑驳陆离.

sentences.en: In short, it's a bit of hodgepodge, full of stark contrasts.
sentences.cn: 简而言之, 有点儿像大杂烩, 反差强烈.

sentences.en: Singapore is an extraordinary hodgepodge of health care principles, but it's also a city-state whose health care system is comprised of fewer than 30 hospitals.
sentences.cn: 新加坡的医疗体系不仅仅是一个各种医疗政策的大杂烩，可惜新加坡本身只是一个仅有30家医院的城市国家。

sentences.en: The Hutts are a hodgepodge of evolutionary traits.
sentences.cn: 赫特人综合了各种进化特征.

sentences.en: Then, the cat attacks hodgepodge was initiated collect post, draft the will of TA.
sentences.cn: 于是, 猫扑大杂烩发起了征集帖, 征集TA的 愿望.

sentences.en: This box is a hodgepodge of books, old toys and things.
sentences.cn: 这个箱子里,书 、 旧玩具及其他物品混杂在一起.

sentences.en: When I dipped closer, I saw they were in a hodgepodge of dark uniforms.
sentences.cn: 我降得更低些, 发现他们穿着深色杂乱的越共服装.

sentences.en: When it comes to spreading ridicule, the Web is now a hodgepodge of celebrity takedowns and videos of ugly brides or of kids who can't sing in the school play.
sentences.cn: 网络已经成为传播尴尬事情的主渠道，其内容堪比大杂烩，既有名人的露丑记录，又有难看的新娘，还有在学校表演中唱不出歌的小孩子。

sentences.en: Your last paragraph made it very clear to me that Benjamin's work is basically a hodgepodge from Kantian rationality through to more updated theories.
sentences.cn: 你最后一段话让它很清楚的告诉我，本雅明的工作是基本上一个大杂烩，从康德的批判理性一直到更新的理论。
